canonical_explanation.text: Geometrical constructions use ruler and compass to accurately draw line segments, angles, and perpendiculars. Key constructions include copying line segments, constructing perpendicular bisectors, creating angles of 60°, 90°, and 120°, bisecting angles, and drawing perpendiculars from points.
rules: Always use a sharp pencil and compass for accurate constructions
Keep compass width fixed when drawing arcs for a construction
Construction lines and arcs should be light and thin
Label all points clearly with capital letters
A perpendicular bisector divides a line segment into two equal parts at 90°
60° angle is constructed using equilateral triangle properties
90° angle can be constructed using perpendicular bisector method
Angle bisector divides an angle into two equal parts
Perpendicular from a point uses arc intersection method

Set compass width equal to length AB
Draw a baseline through point P
Place compass at P and draw arc on baseline
Mark intersection point as Q, so PQ = AB

ordering_items: Draw line segment AB
Set compass to radius more than half of AB
Draw arcs from A above and below AB
Draw arcs from B with same radius intersecting previous arcs
Join the two intersection points to form perpendicular bisector

questions.question_text: Arrange the steps to construct a perpendicular bisector of segment AB:
correct_answer: Set compass to radius more than half of AB
Draw arcs from A above and below AB
Draw arcs from B with same radius intersecting previous arcs
Join the two intersection points to form perpendicular bisector

ordering_items: Draw ray AB with A as vertex
Place compass at A and draw an arc cutting AB at point P
Keep same compass width and place compass at P
Draw another arc intersecting the first arc at Q
Join A to Q to form 60° angle
questions.hint: This construction uses the equilateral triangle property with equal radii.

Place compass at A and draw an arc cutting AB at point P

Join A to Q to form 60° angle

ordering_items: Draw angle AOB with vertex at O
Place compass at O and draw arc intersecting OA at P and OB at Q
Place compass at P and draw an arc in the interior of angle
Place compass at Q with same radius and draw arc intersecting previous arc at R
Join O to R to create the angle bisector
questions.hint: You need to create intersection points on both arms first, then arcs from those points.

correct_answer: Draw angle AOB with vertex at O
Place compass at O and draw arc intersecting OA at P and OB at Q
Place compass at P and draw an arc in the interior of angle
Place compass at Q with same radius and draw arc intersecting previous arc at R
Join O to R to create the angle bisector
